alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 4:38AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding due to moderate to locally heavy rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara. * WHEN...Until 600 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 436 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rainfall with a band rain moving into the Central Coast of California. Rainfall rates with this band have been observed to be between 0.25 and 0.50 inch per hour. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Maria, San Luis Obispo, Lompoc, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Santa Ynez, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Gaviota State Park, Refugio State Beach, El Capitan State Beach, and Grover Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
